# Sending Templated Notification
Once you've created the template using your Engagespot dashboard, it can be sent using the <a href="/docs/rest-api#tag/Notifications/paths/~1v3~1notifications/post">send notification API</a> itself.
You just need to specify the `templateId` (which you can see on your dashboard), and the key value pairs for the placeholders that you want to be replaced in your template.

<Tabs>
<TabItem value="node" label="Node">

```js
const { EngagespotClient } = require("@engagespot/node");
const client = EngagespotClient({
    apiKey: "YOUR_ENGAGESPOT_API_KEY",
    apiSecret: "YOUR_ENGAGESPOT_API_SECRET"
});

client.send({
    notification:{
        templateId:483561
    },
    recipients:['<your-users-unique-identifier>']
});
```

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="curl" label="cURL">

```bash
curl --location --request POST 'https://api.engagespot.co/v3/notifications' \
--header 'X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY: YOUR_ENGAGESPOT_API_KEY' \
--header 'X-ENGAGESPOT-API-SECRET: YOUR_ENGAGESPOT_API_SECRET' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
    {
    "notification": {
        "templateId": 483561        
    },
    "data":{
        "taskId":"T-17394",
        "comment":"I will do it"
    },
    "recipients": [
        "<your-users-unique-identifier>"
    ]
  }
}'
```

</TabItem>

</Tabs>
